channel.title: Dmca
channel.description:
Just thought I'd warn you guys that Jagex has been issuing alot of DMCA notices lately, I received one today.
Here's a segment of the notice:
[code]a) The Website is involved in unauthorized distribution of a modified RuneScape Game Client, also known as the "epicurus Game Client". The pirated and illegitimately modified version of the RuneScape Game Client is provided for public access at the following addresses:
http://www.epicurus-rsps.net/webclient/
www.epicurus-rsps.net/downloads/EpicurusClientLauncher.exe
The epicurus Game Client is a duplication of the official RuneScape Game Client materials (including copyrighted names and artwork) available for review at http://www.runescape.com/game.ws?autocreate=true&ab=1&j=1, reproduced without consent or license. [/code]
I had a TOS on my website, it rendered ineffective.

item.title: Dmca
item.dc:creator: @Dextrell Dextrell
item.description:
@Dextrell wrote:

As long as the file is not on the host technically your not hosting any illegal content

Read full topic

item.title: Dmca
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Sorry for the bump…

I’m wondering about the DCMA. My website contains an external link to a client. Also, it loads an external Jar for my webclient. The cache is also hosted on a separate server. There is nothing that is owned by Jagex on my webhost. On my VPS, a Java program (that happens to be compatible with the RS317 client) exists. Can Jagex still sue me for containing links to copyrighted material?

Read full topic

item.title: Dmca
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:432142”][quote author=whackatre link=topic=534852.msg3912429#msg3912429 date=1328889191]

Jagex can’t do anything to most offshore VPS companies.

Except you don’t live ‘offshore’, so they can still go after you personally.

I do
[/quote]

What is your definition of ‘offshore’, because they can sue you in probably any civilized country in the world.[/quote]

Depends on your definition of “civilized” Russia doesn’t give a fuck. Neither do many other Eastern European countries.

Read full topic

Except you don’t live ‘offshore’, so they can still go after you personally.

I do

What is your definition of ‘offshore’, because they can sue you in probably any civilized country in the world.[/quote]

I don’t think China would care.

Read full topic

item.description:

Jagex can’t do anything to most offshore VPS companies.

Except you don’t live ‘offshore’, so they can still go after you personally.
[/quote]

I do ;P[/quote]

What is your definition of ‘offshore’, because they can sue you in probably any civilized country in the world.

Read full topic

item.title: Dmca
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

They generally don’t do much except continue to pester your host until they take it down. That’s why moving off shores is usually the best solution. The only rsps that ever actually got sued as far as I know was frugooscape. From what I’ve heard, those guys were huge. Unless you’re pulling in thousands of dollars a day from your rsps, you should be fine =P

Read full topic
